encryption_at_rest.score:
Yes for Artifact, logs, cache,
report exports

Codebuild.CO1.description: Prevent CodeBuild projects to communicate directly from the Service team AWS accounts by launching projects in authorized and secure VPC only

Codebuild.CO2.description: Launch CodeBuild projects in subnets with sufficient IP space

Codebuild.CO3.description: Launch CodeBuild projects in subnets with sufficient AZ redundancy

Codebuild.CO4.description: Protect the buildspec content and injection process

Codebuild.CO6.description: Keep encryption enabled for artifacts, logs and cache, and use authorized KMS keys

Codebuild.CO7.description: Use a dedicated IAM service role for each CodeBuild project

Codebuild.CO8.description: Log the output of CodeBuild projects in a secure location

Codebuild.CO9.description: Limit the IAM entities allowed to execute the IAM actions required to perform the attack, including limiting them to VPC when possible

Codebuild.CO10.description: Attach only authorized EFS filesystems to CodeBuild projects

Codebuild.CO11.description: Protect how RAM is used to share

Codebuild.CO13.description: Run build on authorized container image(s) only

Codebuild.CO14.description: Connect to ECR only via IAM roles if same AWS account (and not directly)

Codebuild.CO15.description: Control the built-in explicit proxy of CodeBuild

Codebuild.CO16.description: Limit session-enabled builds and control session access

Codebuild.CO17.description: Use a dedicated IAM service role for each build batch

Codebuild.CO20.description: Deploy only authorized projects to be publicly-visble and attach only a dedicated IAM service role to them

Codebuild.CO21.description: Ensure only need-to-know information about the builds are shared with the source providers

Codebuild.T1.name: Exfiltrate data or elevate privilege by creating a malicious build (by creating a new project, changing a project or overwriting it at build)
Codebuild.T1.description: Builds are using sources, filesystem, images, and buildspecs as input and execute instruction for output. It can be overwritten (all but the filesystem) when starting the build or reconfiguring the project. An attacker can change the behavior of the build by modifying the buildspec in order to exfiltrate data (e.g. calling an external endpoint, accessing other S3 buckets/code commit, adding confidential data in the artifact/report/logs, modifying the name of the artifact to include confidential data), or elevate privilege using the IAM service role.

Codebuild.T2.name: Denial of Service by exhausting the number of IPs in subnets used by a CodeBuild project build
Codebuild.T2.description: When the CodeBuild is launched in the VPC, a network interface is created in one subnet configured in the build, even if several are configured. By default the limit of concurrent build is 60 (ref). An attacker can launch several builds to exhaust the number of IP available in order to disrupt other processes using the same range of IPs.

Codebuild.T3.name: Access to sensitive data in environment variables
Codebuild.T3.description: Environment variables are used to abstract certain values from the build, including secrets. An attacker can discover secrets if not appropriately secured.

Codebuild.T4.name: Use the build status to exfiltrate data (Bitbucket or GitHub via creds)
Codebuild.T4.description: CodeBuild allows project owners to communicate a free field to Bitbucket or GitHub for the commit status. An attacker can modify the value to exfiltrate data toward a source code repository they register with credentials in CodeBuild (or a public repo you created).

Codebuild.T5.name: Run a poisoned image to affect the build, run cryptomining or steal information
Codebuild.T5.description: CodeBuild uses containers to run the build, where you decide the image to run on. An attacker can affect an image to affect the build, run cryptomining or steal data.

Codebuild.T6.name: Recon on CodeBuild resources with RAM
Codebuild.T6.description: CodeBuild can use RAM to share CodeBuild projects or resource groups. It is in view-only mode only. An attacker can use those information to do reconnaissance about the CodeBuild projects and report groups.

Codebuild.T7.name: Bypass routing table via proxy
Codebuild.T7.description: CodeBuild can proxy requests, including logs and artifacts. An attacker can use a proxy to bypass network security from CodeBuild.

Codebuild.T8.name: Use the build status to exfiltrate data (Bitbucket or GitHub via OAuth)
Codebuild.T8.description: CodeBuild allows project owners to communicate a free field to Bitbucket or GitHub for the commit status. An attacker can modify the value to exfiltrate data toward a source code repository they register with OAuth in CodeBuild (or a public repo you created).

Codebuild.T9.name: Elevate privilege via the Session Manager
Codebuild.T9.description: CodeBuild allows users to connect to the build container (ref), requiring specific SSM permission on the IAM service role and configuring debugSessionEnabled at start of the build, and add a special CodeBuild command to pause the build. An attacker can connect to the build container and run commands to modify the build or use the IAM service role permissions.

Codebuild.T10.name: Unauthorized execution of a build via BuildBatch
Codebuild.T10.description: StartBuild permission enables several threats. An attacker can use the BuildBatch to execute attacks on CodeBuild with StartBuild.

Codebuild.T11.name: Unauthorized public project
Codebuild.T11.description: When you enable public build access, your build results, including logs and artifacts, are accessible to the general public. An attacker (or someone by negligence) can enable public access, revealing potentially confidential information.

Codebuild.C1.description: Enforce CodeBuild in VPC by abstracting the creation of CodeBuild as part of the infrastructure-as-code. No native mechanism prevents the creation of a CodeBuild not in VPC.
Codebuild.C1.testing: Request the process and records of enforcing CodeBuild in VPC

Codebuild.C2.description: Monitor that CodeBuild project configuration includes VPC configuration (CreateProject, UpdateProject) with the CloudTrail log (responseElements.project.source.vpcConfig exists)
Codebuild.C2.testing: Create/update a CodeBuild project without VPC configuration, it should be detected

Codebuild.C3.description: Monitor that CodeBuild project during build includes VPC configuration using the CloudTrail events (StartBuild) with the CloudTrail log (responseElements.build.source.vpcConfig exists)
Codebuild.C3.testing: Run a build without VPC configuration, it should be detected

Codebuild.C4.description: Verify all CodeBuild projects are in VPC.
Codebuild.C4.testing: Create a CodeBuild project not in VPC, it should be detected.

Codebuild.C5.description: Maintain a list of authorized VPCs, subnets and Security Groups by CodeBuild project
Codebuild.C5.testing: Request the list of all authorized VPC and subnets by CodeBuild projects, its review process and its review records

Codebuild.C72.description: Ensure CodeBuild projects are only in authorized VPCs/subnets, with authorized Security Groups
Codebuild.C72.testing: Request the mechanism ensuring CodeBuild projects are only in authorized VPCs and subnets, with authorized Security Groups, and the evidence of its execution

Codebuild.C6.description: Verify all CodeBuild projects are configured in an authorized VPC, subnets and Security Groups
Codebuild.C6.testing: Create a CodeBuild project in an unauthorized 1) VPC, 2) subnet, or 3) Security Group, it should be detected.

Codebuild.C7.description: Define and enforce a required minimum number of available IP addresses in CodeBuild-authorized VPC and subnets for the maximum number of concurrent build execution (default: 60).
Codebuild.C7.testing: Request the definition and enforcement process of a minimum number of available IP addresses in CodeBuild-authorized VPC and subnets.

Codebuild.C8.description: Verify all subnets used by CodeBuild projects have the minimum number of IP addresses available for the maximum number of concurrent build execution (default: 60).
Codebuild.C8.testing: Create a CodeBuild project not in subnet with limited IP space availability, it should be detected.

Codebuild.C9.description: Define and implement a number of required AZ/subnets per CodeBuild project depending on the availability requirements (note: you may use a default value to simplify governance, e.g. 3 different subnets in 3 different AZs per project)
Codebuild.C9.testing: Request the governance of the availability of CodeBuild projects by AZs.

Codebuild.C10.description: Verify all CodeBuild projects are configured in defined numbers of AZs.
Codebuild.C10.testing: Create a CodeBuild project configured with not enough number of AZs, it should be detected.

Codebuild.C11.description: Direct that the network interfaces created by CodeBuild are protected using the VPC ThreatModel
Codebuild.C11.testing: Request the VPC ThreatModel and the evidence of its application to the network interfaces created by CodeBuild

Codebuild.C12.description: Enforce usage the version 0.2 in buildspec
Codebuild.C12.testing: Request the process and records of enforcing buildspec v0.2

Codebuild.C13.testing: Create a buildpec in v0.1, it should be detected

Codebuild.C14.description: Monitor abnormal behavior on the number of builds (e.g. using the CloudWatch metric "Builds" with abnormally detection)
Codebuild.C14.testing: Create a sudden high number of build, it should be detected

Codebuild.C15.description: Monitor failed build with the INSUFFICIENT_SUBNET error (e.g. in CW logs or CW events)
Codebuild.C15.testing: Create a build in a full subnet, it should be detected.

Codebuild.C16.description: Enforce review on TLS/SSL warnings on source code by setting the insecureSsl configuration to False on all primary and secondary sources
Codebuild.C16.testing: Request the process and records of enforcing the insecureSsl configuration to False

Codebuild.C17.description: Monitor that CodeBuild project configuration ensures valid TLS/SSL on source code using the CloudTrail events (CreateProject, UpdateProject) with the CloudTrail log (responseElements.project.source.insecureSsl = False and if secondarySources is not empty, then responseElements.project.secondarySources.insecureSsl = False)
Codebuild.C17.testing: Create/update a CodeBuild project with insecureSsl sets to False, it should be detected

Codebuild.C18.description: Monitor that CodeBuild project during build ensures valid TLS/SSL on source code using the CloudTrail events (StartBuild) with the CloudTrail log (responseElements.source.insecureSsl = False)
Codebuild.C18.testing: Run a build with insecureSsl sets to False, it should be detected

Codebuild.C19.description: Verify the insecureSsl configuration is set to False on all primary and secondary sources
Codebuild.C19.testing: Create a source with the insecureSsl configuration set to true, it should be detected

Codebuild.C20.description: Enforce encryption is not bypassed for artifacts/reports stored on S3 (either primary or secondary) by the encryptionDisabled configuration
Codebuild.C20.testing: Request the process and records of enforcing the encryptionDisabled configuration to False

Codebuild.C21.description: Verify encryptionDisabled for all artifacts/reports stored in S3 are set to False (either primary or secondary)
Codebuild.C21.testing: Create a source with the encryptionDisabled configuration for an artifact, it should be detected

Codebuild.C22.description: Use a dedicated IAM service role for each CodeBuild project, with permissions limited to perform the build only, and limiting VPC permission to create network interfaces only in authorized VPCs.
Codebuild.C22.testing: Request the processes and records of enforcing the use of dedicated IAM service role in CodeBuild project, and limiting permissions

Codebuild.C23.description: Verify projects are using dedicated IAM service roles on each CodeBuild project
Codebuild.C23.testing: Create 2 CodeBuild projects with the same IAM service role, it should be detected

Codebuild.C24.description: Maintain a list of authorized KMS keys by CodeBuild project to encrypt cache, artifacts and/or logs. CodeBuild uses the same KMS KMS key for all.
Codebuild.C24.testing: Request the list of all KMS keys by CodeBuild project for encryption of cache, artifact and/or logs

Codebuild.C73.description: Ensure only authorized KMS keys by CodeBuild project to encrypt cache, artifact and/or logs; and that encryptionDisabled for all logs stored in S3 are set to False
Codebuild.C73.testing: Request the mechanism ensuring only authorized KMS keys by CodeBuild project to encrypt cache, artifact and/or logs, and that encryptionDisabled for all logs stored in S3 are set to False; and the evidence of its execution

Codebuild.C25.testing: Create/update a CodeBuild project with no encryption or with an unauthorized KMS key, it should be detected

Codebuild.C26.testing: Run a build with no encryption or with an unauthorized KMS key, it should be detected

Codebuild.C27.description: Verify CodeBuild projects cache, artifact and/or logs are encrypted with an unauthorized KMS key.
Codebuild.C27.testing: Create/update a CodeBuild project with no encryption or with an unauthorized KMS key, it should be detected

Codebuild.C28.description: Enforce logging on CodeBuild projects (i.e. with CW logs and/or encrypted S3 logs)
Codebuild.C28.testing: Request the process and records of enforcing logging on CodeBuild (and encrypted for S3)

Codebuild.C29.testing: Request the list of all CW log groups or S3 buckets allowed for logs of CodeBuild projects

Codebuild.C30.description: Verify the log configuration is enabled on CW or S3, in authorized targets, and for S3, the bucket ownership is correct.

Codebuild.C31.description: Verify encryptionDisabled for all logs stored in S3 are set to False
Codebuild.C31.testing: Create a project with the encryptionDisabled configuration for logs, it should be detected

Codebuild.C32.testing: Request the list of authorized IAM principal that have the permissions required to launch the attack, its review process and its review records

Codebuild.C33.testing: Request the list of authorized IAM principal that have the permissions required to launch the attack within or outside allowed VPCs, its review process and its review records

Codebuild.C35.testing: Create/update a CodeBuild project to mount an unauthorized EFS filesystem, it should be detected

Codebuild.A1.name: Build project
Codebuild.A1.description: A build project includes information about how to run a build, including where to get the source code, which build environment to use, which build commands to run, and where to store the build output.

Codebuild.A2.action_description: Gets information about one or more builds.
Codebuild.A2.name: Build project
Codebuild.A2.description: A build project includes information about how to run a build, including where to get the source code, which build environment to use, which build commands to run, and where to store the build output.

Codebuild.A3.action_description: Gets information about one or more build projects.
Codebuild.A3.name: Build project
Codebuild.A3.description: A build project includes information about how to run a build, including where to get the source code, which build environment to use, which build commands to run, and where to store the build output.

Codebuild.A4.action_description: Returns an array of ReportGroup objects that are specified by the input reportGroupArns parameter.
Codebuild.A4.name: Reports (from CodeBuild builds only)
Codebuild.A4.description: You can create reports in CodeBuild that contain details about tests or code coverage that are run during builds. You can create tests such as unit tests, configuration tests, and functional tests.

Codebuild.A5.action_description: Returns an array of the report objects specified by the input reportArns parameter.
Codebuild.A5.name: Reports (from CodeBuild builds only)
Codebuild.A5.description: You can create reports in CodeBuild that contain details about tests or code coverage that are run during builds. You can create tests such as unit tests, configuration tests, and functional tests.

Codebuild.A6.action_description: Adds or updates information about a test report.
Codebuild.A6.name: Reports (from CodeBuild builds only)
Codebuild.A6.description: You can create reports in CodeBuild that contain details about tests or code coverage that are run during builds. You can create tests such as unit tests, configuration tests, and functional tests.

Codebuild.A7.name: Build project
Codebuild.A7.description: A build project includes information about how to run a build, including where to get the source code, which build environment to use, which build commands to run, and where to store the build output.

Codebuild.A8.action_description: Creates a report. A report is created when tests specified in the buildspec file for a report group run during the build of a project.
Codebuild.A8.name: Reports (from CodeBuild builds only)
Codebuild.A8.description: You can create reports in CodeBuild that contain details about tests or code coverage that are run during builds. You can create tests such as unit tests, configuration tests, and functional tests.

Codebuild.A9.name: Reports (from CodeBuild builds only)
Codebuild.A9.description: You can create reports in CodeBuild that contain details about tests or code coverage that are run during builds. You can create tests such as unit tests, configuration tests, and functional tests.

Codebuild.A10.action_description: For an existing AWS CodeBuild build project that has its source code stored in a GitHub or Bitbucket repository, enables AWS CodeBuild to start rebuilding the source code every time a code change is pushed to the repository.
Codebuild.A10.name: Webhooks
Codebuild.A10.description: For a CodeBuild build project that has its source code stored in a GitHub or Bitbucket repository, webhooks can be used to rebuild the source code every time a code change is pushed to the repository.

Codebuild.A11.action_description: Deletes an OAuth token from a connected third-party OAuth provider. Only used in the AWS CodeBuild console.
Codebuild.A11.name: Cloud repo authentication (OAuth)
Codebuild.A11.description: You can connect to source code providers, via OAuth.

Codebuild.A12.name: Build project
Codebuild.A12.description: A build project includes information about how to run a build, including where to get the source code, which build environment to use, which build commands to run, and where to store the build output.

Codebuild.A13.name: Reports (from CodeBuild builds only)
Codebuild.A13.description: You can create reports in CodeBuild that contain details about tests or code coverage that are run during builds. You can create tests such as unit tests, configuration tests, and functional tests.

Codebuild.A14.name: Reports (from CodeBuild builds only)
Codebuild.A14.description: You can create reports in CodeBuild that contain details about tests or code coverage that are run during builds. You can create tests such as unit tests, configuration tests, and functional tests.

Codebuild.A15.action_description: Deletes a resource policy for the associated project or report group.
Codebuild.A15.name: Share projects or report groups cross-AWS-account via RAM (view only)
Codebuild.A15.description: Sharing allows other AWS accounts or users to view AWS CodeBuild projects, report groups, its unexpired reports, and the test results of its reports. In this model, the AWS account that owns the project/report group (owner) shares with other AWS accounts (consumers). A consumer cannot edit/run a project or edit a report group.

Codebuild.A16.action_description: Deletes a set of GitHub, GitHub Enterprise, or Bitbucket source credentials.
Codebuild.A16.name: Cloud repo authentication (Personal Access Token)
Codebuild.A16.description: You can connect to source code providers, via Personal Access Token.

Codebuild.A17.action_description: For an existing AWS CodeBuild build project that has its source code stored in a GitHub or Bitbucket repository, stops AWS CodeBuild from rebuilding the source code every time a code change is pushed to the repository.
Codebuild.A17.name: Webhooks
Codebuild.A17.description: For a CodeBuild build project that has its source code stored in a GitHub or Bitbucket repository, webhooks can be used to rebuild the source code every time a code change is pushed to the repository.

Codebuild.A18.action_description: Returns an array of TestCase objects.
Codebuild.A18.name: Reports (from CodeBuild builds only)
Codebuild.A18.description: You can create reports in CodeBuild that contain details about tests or code coverage that are run during builds. You can create tests such as unit tests, configuration tests, and functional tests.

Codebuild.A19.action_description: Returns a resource policy for the specified project or report group.
Codebuild.A19.name: Share projects or report groups cross-AWS-account via RAM (view only)
Codebuild.A19.description: Sharing allows other AWS accounts or users to view AWS CodeBuild projects, report groups, its unexpired reports, and the test results of its reports. In this model, the AWS account that owns the project/report group (owner) shares with other AWS accounts (consumers). A consumer cannot edit/run a project or edit a report group.

Codebuild.A20.action_description: Imports the source repository credentials for an AWS CodeBuild project that has its source code stored in a GitHub, GitHub Enterprise, or Bitbucket repository.
Codebuild.A20.name: Cloud repo authentication (Personal Access Token)
Codebuild.A20.description: You can connect to source code providers, via Personal Access Token.

Codebuild.A21.action_description: Resets the cache for a project.
Codebuild.A21.name: Build project
Codebuild.A21.description: A build project includes information about how to run a build, including where to get the source code, which build environment to use, which build commands to run, and where to store the build output.

Codebuild.A22.action_description: Gets a list of build IDs, with each build ID representing a single build.
Codebuild.A22.name: Build project
Codebuild.A22.description: A build project includes information about how to run a build, including where to get the source code, which build environment to use, which build commands to run, and where to store the build output.

Codebuild.A23.action_description: Gets a list of build IDs for the specified build project, with each build ID representing a single build.
Codebuild.A23.name: Build project
Codebuild.A23.description: A build project includes information about how to run a build, including where to get the source code, which build environment to use, which build commands to run, and where to store the build output.

Codebuild.A24.action_description: Lists connected third-party OAuth providers. Only used in the AWS CodeBuild console.
Codebuild.A24.name: Cloud repo authentication (OAuth)
Codebuild.A24.description: You can connect to source code providers, via OAuth.

Codebuild.A25.action_description: Gets information about Docker images that are managed by AWS CodeBuild.
Codebuild.A25.name: Build project
Codebuild.A25.description: A build project includes information about how to run a build, including where to get the source code, which build environment to use, which build commands to run, and where to store the build output.

Codebuild.A26.action_description: Gets a list of build project names, with each build project name representing a single build project.
Codebuild.A26.name: Build project
Codebuild.A26.description: A build project includes information about how to run a build, including where to get the source code, which build environment to use, which build commands to run, and where to store the build output.

Codebuild.A27.action_description: Returns a list of report group ARNs. Each report group ARN represents one report group.
Codebuild.A27.name: Reports (from CodeBuild builds only)
Codebuild.A27.description: You can create reports in CodeBuild that contain details about tests or code coverage that are run during builds. You can create tests such as unit tests, configuration tests, and functional tests.

Codebuild.A28.action_description: Returns a list of report ARNs. Each report ARN representing one report.
Codebuild.A28.name: Reports (from CodeBuild builds only)
Codebuild.A28.description: You can create reports in CodeBuild that contain details about tests or code coverage that are run during builds. You can create tests such as unit tests, configuration tests, and functional tests.

Codebuild.A29.action_description: Returns a list of report ARNs that belong to the specified report group. Each report ARN represents one report.

Codebuild.A29.description: You can create reports in CodeBuild that contain details about tests or code coverage that are run during builds. You can create tests such as unit tests, configuration tests, and functional tests.

Codebuild.A30.action_description: Lists source code repositories from a connected third-party OAuth provider. Only used in the AWS CodeBuild console.
Codebuild.A30.name: Cloud repo authentication (OAuth)
Codebuild.A30.description: You can connect to source code providers, via OAuth.

Codebuild.A31.action_description: Returns a list of project ARNs that have been shared with the requester. Each project ARN represents one project.
Codebuild.A31.name: Share projects or report groups cross-AWS-account via RAM (view only)
Codebuild.A31.description: Sharing allows other AWS accounts or users to view AWS CodeBuild projects, report groups, its unexpired reports, and the test results of its reports. In this model, the AWS account that owns the project/report group (owner) shares with other AWS accounts (consumers). A consumer cannot edit/run a project or edit a report group.
